'Are you really going to give her this?'%K%P
'Of course. If we follow this plan we'll be\nfinished in no time!'%K%P
Maika winked, full of confidence. I couldn't say I\nshared her enthusiasm for the schedule she'd\ncreated.%K%P
Even after reducing it to the bare minimum,\nit would still cut Akane's free time in half.%K%P
Throwing this at her out of nowhere might\nnot end well.%K%P
'Akane, do you have a minute?'%K%P
'Huh? What is it.'%K%P
'Here.'%K%P
Akane was laying down, as usual, but Maika strode\nforward and handed her the stack of papers she'd\njust written up.%K%P
'What's this?'%K%P
'It's your new rehabilitation schedule.\nI know it looks like a lot, but I'll be here\nwith you every step of the way.'%K%P
Akane glanced over the schedule.\nShe didn't look impressed.%K%P
Since Maika had started 'helping', Akane had gone\nalong with her suggestions without complaining.%K%P
But now...%K%P
'Let's go, Akane. We've got cleaning to attend to.'%K%P
'Aw, but so much has happened lately,\ncan't I at least take today off?'%K%P
'Maika, one day won't hurt, right?\nAkane has been working hard.'%K%P
'No deal. I want to help reform Akane and save\nTsubaki ASAP. Even one day can make all the\ndifference.'%K%P
Maika tried to hurry Akane into getting up,\nbut the goddess didn't move.%K%P
'Akane? Come on, hurry up and--'%K%P
'No.'%K%P
'Huh?'%K%P
'I said no. I don't wanna.'%K%P
'C-Come on, Akane. If we don't properly\nrehabilitate you, Tsubaki will--'%K%P
'I don't care! Sho does his best for my sake,\nso I don't mind trying hard for him.'%K%P
'But all you care about is yourself, Maika. It's no\nfun here anymore! If this is how you want\nthis house to be, I won't lift a finger to save it!'%K%P
'What?! You're just going to let it disappear?!'%K%P
'Yeah, why not? I don't care about it anymore.'%K%P
'Akane...you're really starting to cross the line!'%K%P
'Hey now, you two, let's all keep cool--'%K%P
'You stay out of this, Sho!'%K%P
'I'm doing everything I can for this place and for\nyou, Akane. Take back what you said!'%K%P
'No, it's the truth. I'll feel bad for you two if you\nlose this place, but that doesn't mean you can\ndo whatever you want to me.'%K%P
'How can you say that? You're supposed to be\nTsubaki's household goddess!'%K%P
'Fine, I'll quit!\nThen it won't matter if I do\nget demoted to being a spirit!'%K%P
'Whoa! Hey, Akane!'%K%P
Akane got up and left, ignoring us when\nwe tried to call her back.%K%P
'Maika, I think you went too far.'%K%P
'But I... I'm sorry. I need to go cool my\nhead a little.'%K%P
Her voice was trembling as she walked away\nand left me alone in the living room.%K%P
After their fight, Akane and Maika made a point\nof avoiding or ignoring each other.%K%P
Maika was so on edge I was afraid to say anything.%K%P
'What am I supposed to do?'%K%P
'Sho.'%K%P
'Inori?'%K%P
I was in my room trying to think of a solution\nwhen Inori came to visit.%K%P
'There's something I need to talk to you about.\nMay I come in?'%K%P
'Of course.'%K%P
'Thank you.'%K%P
'Feel free to sit wherever.'%K%P
She sat down facing me, her posture stiff and formal.%K%P
'You said you needed to talk?'%K%P
'Akane and Maika both seem irritated.\nDid something happen between them?'%K%P
Well, she was bound to ask.%K%P
I told Inori all about the fight between\nAkane and Maika.%K%P
'I see. That explains their behavior.'%K%P
'I feel responsible. If I'd seen this coming a\nlittle sooner...'%K%P
'It's not your fault.\nBut this might pose\nquite a serious problem.'%K%P
'Yeah, Akane's going to lose interest in her\nrehabilitation again.'%K%P
'Well, that's part of it, yes. But it could be even\nworse if Akane really does resign\nher position as household goddess.'%K%P
'What would be so bad about that?'%K%P
'Just as I have a duty to watch over Kannagi Town,\nAkane's role is to protect Tsubaki Apartments\nfrom misfortune and disaster.'%K%P
'These duties are important for us goddesses.\nIt didn't seem relevant before,\nbut allow me to make something clear.'%K%P
'If Akane really does unceremoniously\nquit being a household goddess, she will definitely\nbe demoted to spirit status.'%K%P
'What? Just from quitting her job?'%K%P
'I do not believe our boss\nwould show mercy to a goddess\nthat has abandoned her duties.'%K%P
'Tsubaki is a very old building. The reason it's\nsurvived so long is because of its household\ngoddess's protection, meager though it may be.'%K%P
'Even if it avoids demolition, without that\ndivine protection it will age rapidly and\nmay even fall apart on its own.'%K%P
I couldn't let that happen.%K%P
I had no idea Akane's power over this place\nwas so important.%K%P
On the other hand...%K%P
'Can she really quit just like that, though?'%K%P
'Normally, no. But Akane is an Aragami.\nHer power tends to respond\ndirectly to her desires.'%K%P
'If she truly wishes to cease being a household\ngoddess, it may very well become so.'%K%P
Inori stopped for breath while I tried to take\nall of it in.%K%P
This was more serious than I thought.%K%P
'Thank you for telling me.'%K%P
'I only did what I had to. I love living here at\nTsubaki Apartments with all of you so much.'%K%P
'So I really don't want it to end like this.'%K%P
'Me too. I won't let all our efforts go to waste.'%K%P
'In that case, I will leave the rest to you.'%K%P
'Sure. I'll find a way to keep everyone happy.'%K%P
I was determined to do whatever it would take.%K%P
